caption:
Join us at the September AstroTour on Thursday, September 5! The event is FREE and open to all. NO PRIOR REGISTRATION REQUIRED!! Our September AstroTour features PhD Candidate Dang Pham's talk on comets at 8:00PM, followed by exciting astronomy demos and telescope tours at 9:00PM!

Talk abstract : Comets at night and the Sun during the day have always mesmerised humanity. Studying how comets move around the Sun is one of the oldest problems in theoretical astrophysics. In this AstroTours, we will explore what comets are made of, how they move, and how you can spot them! Then, we will explore what will happen to comets billions of years from now, when the Sun will have exhausted its nuclear fuel and become a white dwarf — a dead star. 

Image Credit: https://news.mit.edu/2017/scientists-detect-comets-outside-our-solar-system-1026

Kick off the year with a 👋 Meet and Greet 🤝 and 🔍 Scavenger Hunt 🔍

Join the Physics Union (PhySU), Astronomy Union (AU), and Math Union (MU) for a dynamic start to the academic year! Connect with fellow students, dive into what each union has to offer, and ask any burning questions. Then, gear up for a scavenger hunt that will lead you through campus, uncovering hidden gems and fun surprises along the way. Whether your passion lies in the stars, equations, or the mysteries of physics, there’s something for everyone!

Don’t miss out on this vibrant start to the year, we’re so excited to see everyone there!

Get ready for an exciting start to the year with our lineup of events! Check out our calendar to see all the activities we have planned for orientation this week. Mark your calendars and join us for a 💫stellar💫 academic year ahead!🎉🫶

P.S. Don’t forget to RSVP for the Astronomy and Astrophysics Building Tour—the link is in our building tour post caption!

✨Spot the Stars at Our Table✨

Join us at the @uoftsu Clubs’ Fair on Front Campus! From cosmic discoveries to stellar conversations, there’s something for everyone. Swing by our orbit to discover more about the AU, chat with members, and dive into the wonders of the universe!

📅 August 30th
🕐 1:00 - 4:00 PM
📍King's College Circle - Front Campus, Table C43

We can’t wait to see you all there!💫🌌🔭

The AU is excited to kick off the new academic year with an enlightening tour of the Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics building! Explore the wonders of our facilities, including the Undergraduate Astronomy Union Lounge and Astronomy Labs.

📅 August 26th

🕟 4:30 PM

📍 2 Ursula Franklin St.

Whether you're a first-year student or a seasoned stargazer, all are welcome to discover what our astronomy department has to offer!🌟🪐🌌

There's a limited number of spots available, so if you're interested, please fill out the following RSVP form: https://forms.gle/49jdbhM1wFco2iMM7

🙋Drop by for a fun (and accessible) astro-themed trivia session at front campus, where you’ll even get to try out a solar telescope 🔭! Make sure to bring along your friends to secure a prize! 🏆

🗓️28th August, 2PM

📍King’s College Circle (grass patch, or adjacent areas if it’s still closed)

#uoft #utsg #astronomy #astrophyiscs #universe #physics #space #telescope

☀️ Summer is ending but we are back in full swing along with our observation nights! Experience the wonders of stargazing on McLennan’s rooftop observatory with us and @au.uoft, and the free snacks that we’ll be providing. We can’t wait to see you all! 🔭

🗓️30th August (day of clubs fair!), 9-11PM

📍McLennan Physical Laboratories (60 St. George Street)

#uoft #astronomy #astrophyiscs #universe #physics #space #telescope

📚✨ Part-time Students: Join Our Part-Time Undergraduate Volunteer Program! ✨📚

Are you looking to join the student movement and not sure how? Your students’ union got you. Join the Association of Part-time Undergraduate Students (APUS) volunteer team and get a chance to improve the lives of Part-Time Students on all three UofT campuses. Support with services, events and campaigns of the organization. 

Why Volunteer with Us?
Flexible Tasks & skill development 
Free workshops and training sessions
Volunteer Certificate
Volunteer appreciation events and awards. CCR
Recommendation Letter 
Opportunity to build community on campus and more…

📅 Deadline for Registration: Sept. 20, 2024 
📍 Registration link in bio: 
🌐 More Info: apus.ca/volunteers

For any questions contact Vice President Outreach & Events Jennifer at vpoutreach@apus.ca

hi friends! our second leadership workshop will be this Saturday August 24th from 6:30pm to 10pm. it will be focused on small group leading and will be lead by some of our AFC(@afccanada) friends! sign up is needed for numbers so please sign up at the google form link in our linktree at your earliest convenience! the event will be held in person and online with the in person option being at NYCBC(North York Chinese Baptist Church) which is accessible by TTC. if you are leading this year or interested/curious in leadership we highly recommend you attend and all are welcome leading this year or not! we hope to see you there 💪💪

note: when signing up select the “rsvp for an existing workshop” option and pick the utsg ccf exclusive one!

Come visit the CSU booth at the UTSU Club Fair happening this upcoming Friday! 

📍Front Campus (D24)
🕐 30th Aug, 1 - 4pm

Feel free to ask current Chemistry students questions, the CSU execs are excited to meet you all! We will be handing out free stickers and snacks 🍫 🌟 See you there!
